meanings.definition: The state or quality of being liquid.
meanings.sent1: The liquidness of the water made it easy to pour into the glass.
meanings.sent2: The liquidness of the oil allowed it to flow smoothly through the pipes.
meanings.sent3: The liquidness of the slime made it fun to play with.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a liquidness to them, flowing effortlessly from her mouth.
meanings.sent5: The liquidness of the lava was mesmerizing as it oozed down the volcano.

meanings.sent1: The river's liquidness carried the leaves downstream.
meanings.sent2: The liquidness of the syrup made it simple to drizzle over the pancakes.
meanings.sent3: The liquidness of the paint made it glide effortlessly on the canvas.
meanings.sent4: His dance moves had a liquidness to them, smooth and graceful.
meanings.sent5: The liquidness of the melted chocolate was perfect for dipping strawberries.

meanings.definition: The ability to take the shape of its container.
meanings.sent1: The liquidness of the mercury allowed it to fill the thermometer.
meanings.sent2: The liquidness of the gelatin molded into the shape of the mold.
meanings.sent3: The liquidness of the clay made it easy to sculpt into different forms.
meanings.sent4: Her adaptability had a liquidness to it, fitting into any situation seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The liquidness of the jello made it wobble in the bowl.
